definition: without two nickels to rub together (idiom)/impoverished

sentences.english: Lk. 21:2 And He saw a certain impoverished widow casting there two lepta .
sentences.chinese: 路二一2又見一個赤貧的寡婦，投了兩個小錢。

sentences.english: There are about 600 million people are suffering from beggary , under the threat of surviving.
sentences.chinese: 其中6億人屬於赤貧，生存問題受到威脅。

sentences.english: Having survived starvation , we're beginning to live happily.
sentences.chinese: 經過了赤貧之後，我們開始了幸福的生活。

sentences.english: Even more be struggle on beggarly line.
sentences.chinese: 甚至更多的是在赤貧線上掙扎。

sentences.english: However this kind of beggarly state can make more heroic dreams undone only.
sentences.chinese: 然而這種赤貧的狀況只會讓更多的英雄夢破滅。

sentences.english: Do you agree or object to the Government in providing public housing to persons in prolonged poverty?
sentences.chinese: 你贊成定反對政府應該提供公屋俾長期赤貧既人士？

sentences.english: Ziarat is a rural part of an impoverished province.
sentences.chinese: 加拉特是這個赤貧省的一個偏遠地區。

sentences.english: In the old society, our family had no food, no clothes, no nothing?
sentences.chinese: 在陳社會里我們野無衣無食，赤貧如洗。

sentences.english: They come from very poor villages where they’ve never seen electricity or toilet paper.
sentences.chinese: 他們來自赤貧的農村，不知電和手紙爲何物。

sentences.english: After the Second World War, East Asia rose from grinding poverty to spectacular prosperity.
sentences.chinese: 第二次世界大戰後，東亞從赤貧一躍而成顯富。

sentences.english: There is a sharp contrast between the poorest and the richest.
sentences.chinese: 赤貧者和鉅富者形成了一個鮮明的對比。

sentences.english: His speculation reduced him to beggary.
sentences.chinese: 他的投機使他陷於赤貧。

definition: lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
to have no sense of shame/brazen
not recognizing one's family (idiom); self-centered and not making any allowances for the needs of one's relatives
toadying for personal gain/to curry favor/to study in great depth
